* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:

+ Presentation and Discussion:  6 hrs
+ Exercise and discussion: 9 hrs
+ Self-study: 90 hrs
* Parallel course(s): None

2. Ph.D Nguyen Thanh Huong Tel: (84)983 168 238 	Email: 	
* Kind of the course: 
* Course language: 	In English                 
* Meeting hour:	 
2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS 
	This course is to prepare students of the Software Engineering	 major with fundamental knowledge of  electricity and magnetism, including: The basic concepts of electric charge and the force between them,  the concepts of the electric field and electric potential, capacitance and energy storage in an electric field;  A current in turn intrinsically produces a magnetic field, examining the force a magnetic field exerts on moving charges and learn how to relate a magnetic field to the current that produces it; Properties of conductors and dielectrics in electric fields and applications; Magnetic nature of magnetic materials and applications; escribing the effects of  time varying magnetic and electric fields, this leads us into Maxwell's Equations and electromagnetic waves. The applications of this topic are fundamental to our society as it encompasses such matters as communication by electromagnetic radiation, functioning of our nervous system and operation of all electronic circuits. This course also helps students obtain other skills: problem solving and teamwork.
3. LEARNING RESOURCES 
Text Books/Lecture Notes:
Electricity and Magnetism, Edward M. Purcell, David J. Morin (2013), third edition, Cambridge University Press.
Physics for scientists and engineers: a strategic approach 4/E with modern physics, Randall D. Knight (2015), fourth edition, Boston: Pearson Education, Inc.
Additional references: 
Lương Duyên Bình, Dư Trí Công, Nguyễn Hữu Hồ, Vật lý Đại cương tập 2: Điện- Dao động- Sóng, NXB Giáo dục.
Lương Duyên Bình (Chủ biên), Bài tập Vật lý Đại cương tập 2: Điện- Dao động- Sóng, NXB Giáo dục.
Tống Thị Hảo Tâm (Chủ biên), Đặng Đình Hải (2019), Bài giảng Vật lý Đại cương (Tâp 1), NXB ĐH Kinh tế Quốc dân.
David Halliday- Robert Resnick- Jearl Walker, Cơ sở vật lí (tập IV), NXB Giáo dục.

9. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION
9.1. Requirements for taking final /terminal exams
Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
9.2. Requirements for attending classes
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
9.3. Requirements for in-class behaviour
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
